FIGREF1.text: 64 policies, including those of the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS). 4 Because of 65 geographic variations in disease incidence and prevalence and in mathematical modelling, the 66 actual implementation of resuming procedural scheduling may differ for different practices and 67 proceed along different timelines. Depending on the results of expanded testing for the novel 68 coronavirus, it is also feasible to consider that universal precautions may evolve to include N-95 69 masks. Whether or not antibody testing or status will be integrated into new procedure 70 scheduling is unknown at this time. also pose crucial issues for hospital facilities, in particular procedural 74 rooms, operating rooms, and also most intensive care units (ICU) whose rooms are also in 75 airflow relationship to the corridors of each ICU suite. Negative pressure air flow is not the 76 standard in these rooms. Different facilities may have different processes and time 77 requirements for implementing negative pressure airflow, air exchanges, and the subsequent 78 reversal of airflow from a positive state. It is worthwhile for electrophysiologists to understand 79 those requirements in their individual practice environments. An example of our approach to 80 both personnel and facility management is shown in Figure 1. 81 Another strength of this multi-society document is the links to online sources such as the CDC. 82 Other cardiovascular COVID19 scientific sites that are frequently updated are: 83 84 • https://www.acc.org/latest-in-cardiology/features/accs-coronavirus-diseasehttps://www.hrsonline.org/COVID19-Challenges-Solutions 87 • https://www.heart.org/en/coronavirus/coronavirus-covid-19-resources 88 • https://www.escardio.org/Education/COVID-19-and-Cardiology 89 The rapid evolution of new data and technology is further illustrated by the Food and Drug 90 Administration (FDA) approval of a hand held device with a mobile phone application for QT 91 interval monitoring that occurred after publication of this manuscript. 5 92 Finally, the importance of shared decision making and the therapeutic benefit of empathetic 93 communication with and respect for patients, families, colleagues and coworkers is

Gleva MD FHRS Cardiology, American Heart Association" is available in Heart Rhythm. 1 This compendium 45 includes a cogent summary of the cardiovascular and arrhythmia implications of COVID19 46 infection and then addresses the complete spectrum of electrophysiology medical care 47 situations from the outpatient clinic, to inpatient visits at both teaching and non-teaching 48 facilities, as well as in acute cardiovascular situations requiring resuscitation. There are also 49 recommendations on staffing and facility utilization.
